about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: If you are convicted of driving with an excessive blood alcohol concentration (BAC), you may be sentenced to serve:

hasPart.assesses: If you are convicted of driving with an excessive blood alcohol concentration (BAC), you may be sentenced to serve: | If you are convicted of driving with an excessive blood alcohol concentration (BAC), you may be sentenced to serve: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If you are convicted of DUI for the first time and you have an excessive BAC level, you may be sentenced to serve up to six months in jail and may be required to pay a fine between $390 and $1,000. Your vehicle may be impounded and is subject to storage fees.

suggestedAnswer.text: Up to six months in jail.

comment.text: Up to six months in jail.
Up to 12 months in jail.

suggestedAnswer.text: No jail time, but you must pay a fine of $500.

comment.text: No jail time, but you must pay a fine of $500.

acceptedAnswer.text: Up to six months in jail.

comment.text: Up to six months in jail.

hasPart.name: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be:

about.name: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be:

hasPart.assesses: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be: | When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curb, your front wheels should be: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When parking on a hill (either uphill or downhill) where there is no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turned to the left (toward the street).

comment.text: Turned to the left (toward the street).

suggestedAnswer.text: Turned to the right (away from the street).

comment.text: Turned to the right (away from the street).
Parallel with the pavement.

acceptedAnswer.text: Turned to the right (away from the street).

comment.text: Turned to the right (away from the street).

answerExplanation.text: When parking on a hill (either uphill or downhill) where there is no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

about.name: When stopped at a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if you:

hasPart.assesses: When stopped at a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if you: | When stopped at a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if you: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may proceed in the direction that a green arrow signal is pointing if you are in the proper lane, regardless of any other signals that are displayed. Before turning, you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and vehicles already within the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: First come to a complete stop.

comment.text: First come to a complete stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Are in the proper lane and the intersection is clear.

comment.text: Are in the proper lane and the intersection is clear.

hasPart.name: What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle?

about.name: What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle?

hasPart.assesses: What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle? | What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Keeping space around your vehicle is important to ensure that you have time to safely react if another driver makes a mistake. For example, extra space around your vehicle may give you time to brake or maneuver out of the way of a vehicle veering into your lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Other drivers can cut in front of you, improving the flow of traffic.

comment.text: Other drivers can cut in front of you, improving the flow of traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: If another driver makes a mistake, you have time to react.

comment.text: If another driver makes a mistake, you have time to react.

suggestedAnswer.text: It inflates to protect you from injury in the case of a collision.

comment.text: It inflates to protect you from injury in the case of a collision.

acceptedAnswer.text: If another driver makes a mistake, you have time to react.

comment.text: If another driver makes a mistake, you have time to react.

answerExplanation.text: Keeping space around your vehicle is important to ensure that you have time to safely react if another driver makes a mistake. For example, extra space around your vehicle may give you time to brake or maneuver out of the way of a vehicle veering into your lane.

comment.text: What is the benefit of a space cushion around your vehicle? | Keeping space around your vehicle is important to ensure that you have time to safely react if another driver makes a mistake. For example, extra space around your vehicle may give you time to brake or maneuver out of the way of a vehicle veering into your lane.

hasPart.name: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means:

about.name: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means:

hasPart.assesses: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means: | A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A flashing yellow signal means "proceed with caution." You should slow down and be alert before entering the upcoming intersection and must yield to any pedestrians, bicycles, or vehicles in the intersection; however, you do not have to stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: You should treat the signal like a stop sign.

comment.text: You should treat the signal like a stop sign.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop. Yield to all cross traffic before crossing in the intersection.

comment.text: Stop. Yield to all cross traffic before crossing in the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.

comment.text: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.

comment.text: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.

answerExplanation.text: A flashing yellow signal means "proceed with caution." You should slow down and be alert before entering the upcoming intersection and must yield to any pedestrians, bicycles, or vehicles in the intersection; however, you do not have to stop.

comment.text: A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means: | A flashing yellow signal means "proceed with caution." You should slow down and be alert before entering the upcoming intersection and must yield to any pedestrians, bicycles, or vehicles in the intersection; however, you do not have to stop.
